title_full:
Kenji Kawai

              (WRWTFWW Records)
label: Original Soundtrack
description:
First ever official vinyl pressing of the soundtrack for Mamoru Oshii’s critically acclaimed and all around legendary science fiction anime film Ghost In The Shell (1995), adapted from Masamune Shirow’s groundbreaking manga series of the same name.

Cut from the original master reels at Emil Berliner Studios (formerly the in-house recording department of... more

label: Dark Entries Records
description:
Unmissable deep dive into Lena Platonos’ unreleased archives c. 1982-1985, emphasising the darker side of her poetic style with something like a Radiophonic score for a stage play of Greek mythology - seriously must-check if you were seduced by ‘Γκάλοπ = Galop’

After introducing the world at large to Lena Platonos’ ineffable allure with 2015’s reissue of ‘Γκάλοπ... more

label: SND
description: Utterly unmissable first ever reissue of SND’s god-tier triple pack, cruelly out of print since 2008, now finally available to discerning dancers/DJs - packing a pinnacle of avant-dance beat science certain to connect with fans of garage, UKF, footwork and experimental techno. If yr into owt from Beatrice Dillon to Timbaland, Ryoji Ikeda to El-B, Autechre to... more

label: Or / Touch
description: Gescom’s infamous ‘MiniDisc’ was the first ever MiniDisc-only release back in 1998. This CD reissue edition contains all 45 tracks (in 88 pieces) from the original MD version, ready for listeners to use on random shuffle function just as the original MD was intended, featuring a photograph of Alan Phillips of Sony showing off the minidisc in a Sony Conference... more

title_full:
KEIJI HAINO

              —
              Tenshi No Gijinka (Seraphic Impostor)
            
              (Tzadik)
label: Seraphic Impostor
description:
Gongs, chimes and voice on this exceptionally tense, genuinely mind-blowing album from 1995. For our money, one of the weirdest and best percussive albums ever made. It's an outstanding iteration of his belief in defying the statement “something can’t come from nothing.” 

Indeed, in Haino’s hands the idea of Ex Nihilo is practised with alchemical... more

title_full:
Hiro Kone

              —
              Silvercoat The Throng
            
              (Dais Records)
label: Dais Records
description:
NYC shapeshifter Hiro Kone is joined by Speaker Music (DeForrest Brown Jr), travis (ONO), and Muqata’a for a more fluid navigation of electronics, dark ambient sound design, and chamber classical.

Crafted during lockdown, ’Silvercoat The Throng’ is Hiro Kone’s most personalised set of recordings yet, written under the title’s poetic directive to create... more

label: L.I.E.S.
description:
Debut album time for one of L.I.E.S.’ most prolific and persistent operators; jakbeat supremo Jason Letkiewicz aka Steve Summers, Malvoeaux, Confused House, Mutant Beat Dance, etc.

Backed to jack your body, Summer’s ‘Generation Loss’ packs a baker’s dozen box bangers in a true skool Chicago style, welding nagging synths to tracky drums in a direct style... more

title_full:
Pamela_ and her sons

            —
            Floating in sun shallows - https://pamelaandhersons.bandcamp.com/album/floating-in-sun-shallows

label: AVIAN
description:
Introspective techno nuance from producer and video game developer Zvarra on Shifted’s Avian

Working in similar textured environments to label boss Shifted, Zvarra exerts a personalised slant on the style with ‘Bizzaroland’, their debut album after a couple of self-released singles on Rare Type. No mistaking, it’s one for the niche techno crowd who appreciate the... more

label: N&J Blueberries
description: HTRK mint their new label with a perfectly formed 5th studio album - in our opinion a career best - finding the duo stripped to a quietly cathartic, windswept arrangement of bare vocals rent with spectral webs of guitar and synth in a modern, classic, wholly inimitable style that will lodge itself deep in your heart. AOTY gear especially recommended if yr into anything... more

title_full:
Matsuo Ohno

            —
            TAJ MAHAL TRAVELLERS ON TOUR - https://www.ubu.com/film/taj_tour.html

label: RVNG Intl.
description:
NYC's Veronica Lauren occupies frayed textural space between the physical and liminal on a deliciously smudged echo of West Coast-styles, puckered new age synths and briny Drexciyan beatdown released on the perennially reliable RVNG Intl.

Operating under the VHVL alias - an acronym for Very High, Very Low - Veronica Lauren perceptively explores the... more

label: Tempa
description: One of the scene's youngest and brightest talents finally drops off his debut album proper for Tempa, and needless to say, it's mucking fassive. Benga has been an integral cog in the dubstep machine since the genres inception, producing his first genre defining e.p at the tender age of 16, with 'Skank/dose' on the original dubstep label, Big Apple, and has since... more

title_full:
Gigi Masin

              —
              Talk To The Sea
            
              (Music From Memory)
label: Music From Memory
description:
Following on from that impressive Leon Lowman retrospective last year, the fledgling 'Music From Memory' label returns to impress with this genuinely sublime set from little known Italian musician Gigi Masin, bringing together archival pieces with more recent recordings.

Masin was part of a small underground scene in Venice, releasing two modestly pressed LP's... more

label: STROOM
description:
‘Dark Matter’ completes a delectable trio of releases surveying Pablo’s Eye, a multifaceted Belgian collective working between ambient electronica, cinematic synth themes and hypnotic minimal rhythms.

Drawn from some 30 years of Pablo’s Eye material, ‘Dark Matter’ oscillates between the shadowy feels found in their ‘Spring Break’ compilation, and their... more
